column4: did you follow the instructions here:  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RestrictedFormats ?
I think that's the one I followed...
i've followed the instructions there for several versions of ubuntu and have always gotten xine to work fine.  i suggest not using totem
totem is the default player. I seldom use it, but it doesn't seem to conflict with gxine.
I wonder why I get a 'package not found' error with gstreamer0.10-pitfdll, following the instructions on the link you gave me.
which link?
the restrictedformats one?
exactly.
is it no good for Breezy?
i've gotten the restrictedformats working all the way back to 5.10
sorry, excuse mine - i think the naming conventions are stupid so i usually refer to them by version #
i'd recommend upgrading to 'edgy eft' which is version 6.10
then you'd probably refer to 'lactrodectus mactans' intead of a 'black widow2...:).
I will upgrade, but I believe you can't skip over a version without running into trouble.
then upgrade twice.  or save your stuff on a cd and do a clean install
yes, I will do that for sure.
good luck, i'm running eft right now, except for my modem problems it's clear sailing
do you happen to know what is the utility to reconfigure the keyboard?
for configuring keyboard shortcuts?
or for configuring the keyboard for another language?
no, to reconfigure the keyboard (the last upgrade rendered my keyboard almost useless).
dunno, i've never had a kb problem.
